newsitem.title: USA: Global TeleMedia says signs $240 mln contract.
newsitem.headline: Global TeleMedia says signs $240 mln contract.

text.p: Global TeleMedia International Inc said Monday it signed a service agreement with a provider of prepaid calling cards worth at least $240 million.
The company added that the provider bought a five percent equity position in the company. It declined to identify the provider, but said it was one of the "country's largest."
The initial term of this agreement, which began May 1, is for 24 months following an initial four month start-up period.

The company expects that, during the start-up period, the provider will buy about $3 million a month of prepaid calling card services, with a minimum guarantee to buy $10 million in services a month after that for the balance of the agreement.
The agreement calls for prepayment of at least one month's projected revenues for the duration of contract. For the year ended December 31, 1996, Global Telemedia reported revenues of $1.4 million.

The company said the deal also guarantees minimum gross profit margins of at least six percent during the start-up stage, which is to raise to a minimum of 10 percent for the balance of the term of the agreement. It plans to invest at least $10 million to expand its switch capacity for the contract.
